text:
Hi,

With Apache 1.3.33, the vulnerability (CVE-2006-3747 - : An off-by-one security
problem in the ldap scheme handling. For some RewriteRules this could lead to a
pointer being written out of bounds.) with Rewrite rules was seen on Linux and
DEC OSF/1.

I built Apache 1.3.37 from sources for these two platforms and am again seeing
the same vulnerable behaviour (A window pops up - "An external application must
be launched to handle ldap: links. Request link").

Why is this so?

Thanks
Laxmi
creator: laxmiharikumar@yahoo.com

text:
That behavior is not the vulnerability.
The vulnerability was the ability with some builds of the code to overlay
storage and cause unintended execution.

You're exercising the ability to map a request to an ldap URL, which is a feature. 

Consult user-support mailing lists or newsgroups for more assistance.
creator: trawick@apache.org
laxmiharikumar@yahoo.com
text:
Just a clarification - The window popping up is the feature. Vulnerability would
have been a crash?

Thanks
Laxmi
